edu.missouri.bayesianEvaluator

Class Trainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.missouri.bayesianEvaluator.Trainer

  • public class Trainer
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods to train (i.e. compute the Conditional Probability Tables) of a Bayesian Network.

    The main(String[]) program can be called on an existing bayesian network and data file by using java Trainer <input data file> <input XMLBIF file> <output XMLBIF file> [Filter criterion] [UseFrequencyDiscretization]

    Since:
    bayesianEvaluator version 0.02 2016-04-02
    Version:
    0.14 2016-04-25
    Author:
    Fernando J. Torre-Mora

      • filterByCriterion

        public static weka.core.Instances filterByCriterion(java.lang.String criterion,
                                                    weka.core.Instances data,
                                                    int i)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Restricts the instances of the given data to just those whose ith column matches t
        Parameters:
        criterion - The String to find in column i
        data - The dataset to be filtered
        i - The index of the column where it is desired to only have criterion as the value
        Returns:
        a subset of data where only the rows with column i equal to criterion
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if data is not suitable for a weka.filters.filter
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if i is not between 0 and data.numAttributes()
        Since:
        0.05 2016-04-08

      • restrictToAttributeSet

        public static weka.core.Instances restrictToAttributeSet(weka.core.Instances data,

                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Restricts the attributes of the given data to those contained in the given attribute set
        Parameters:
        data - the dataset to be filtered
        attributeSet - The set of attributes to restrict the dataset to. Must be a subset of the attributes in the dataset
        Returns:
        A dataset with the same number of instances, but with only the attributes from data that were in attributeSet
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if data is not suitable for a weka.filters.filter
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are attributes in attributeSet that are not in data
        Since:
        0.05 2016-04-08

      • reorderAttributes

        public static weka.core.Instances reorderAttributes(weka.core.Instances data,
                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> attributeOrder)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Reorders the attributes in the given dataset to be in the order specified

        Note: data will be modified by this function
        Parameters:
        data - The dataset to be ordered
        attributeOrder - A list of attribute names giving the order desired
        Returns:
        A modified dataset with each instance having its attributes in the order given by attributeOrder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if attributeOrder is not composed of the attributes from the given dataset
        Since:
        0.07 2016-04-09

      • discretizeToBayes

        public static weka.core.Instances discretizeToBayes(weka.core.Instances data,
                                                    weka.classifiers.bayes.BayesNet bn,
                                                    boolean useEqualFrequency)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                    java.lang.ArithmeticException,
                                                    java.lang.AssertionError,
                                                    java.lang.Exception
        Discretizes the given dataset ensuring each attribute has as many possible values as specified by the given bayesian network
        Parameters:
        data - the dataset to be discretized
        bn - A bayesian network whose nodes are the attributes in data
        useEqualFrequency - Specifies whether to split the values into groups of equal frequency (true), or into groups of equal width ( false)
        Returns:
        a dataset where all the values have been converted to nominal, each with as many possible values as the node of the same name in bn had
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the bayesian network names an attribute not present in the data
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - If any one of the attributes does not have enough data to be discretized into the number of bins in the corresponding node in bn (e.g.: attempting to put 2 data points into 3 bins)
        java.lang.AssertionError - If any one of the attributes of data is not discretizable by weka.filters.unsupervised.attribute.Discretize (i.e. is already discrete or is a text attribute)
        java.lang.Exception - if data is not suitable for a weka.filters.filter
        Since:
        0.05 2016-04-08

      • conformToNetwork

        public static weka.core.Instances conformToNetwork(weka.core.Instances data,
                                                   weka.classifiers.bayes.BayesNet bn,
                                                   boolean useEqualFrequency)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception,
                                                   java.lang.AssertionError,
                                                   java.lang.ArithmeticException,
                                                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Conforms the data to be succesfully used by weka.classifiers.bayes.BayesNet.estimateCPTs() to train the given Bayesian network
        Parameters:
        data - The data to adapt to the bayesian network
        bn - The Bayesian network the data will be used with
        useEqualFrequency - Specifies whether to split the values into groups of equal frequency (see discretizeToBayes(Instances, BayesNet, boolean))
        Returns:
        a dataset where the attributes have been restricted to, and ordered to match, the given bayesian network, and the values of those attributes have been discretized to match the number of values specified in the bayesian network
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the bayesian network names an attribute not present in the data
        java.lang.AssertionError - If any one of the attributes of data is not discretizable by weka.filters.unsupervised.attribute.Discretize (i.e. is already discrete or is a text attribute)
        java.lang.Exception - if data is not suitable for a weka.filters.filter
        java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Since:
        0.08 2016-04-10

      • trainToFile

        public static void trainToFile(weka.classifiers.bayes.net.EditableBayesNet bn,
                               weka.core.Instances data,
                               java.lang.String filename)
                        throws java.lang.Exception,
                               java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Trains the given network with the given data and stores the result with the given filename. Note that bn is modified by this function. Also note that if the columns in data are not already in the same order as the nodes in bn, unpredictable behavior may result—use conformToNetwork(Instances, BayesNet, boolean) or reorderAttributes(Instances, List) for this purpose.

        To train the Bayesian network without generating a file, call

        Parameters:
        bn - The Bayesian network to be trained
        data - The data with which to train the Bayesian network
        filename - The name of the file to save the Bayesian network in
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the number of columns in data does not match the number of nodes in bn (use conformToNetwork(Instances, BayesNet, boolean) or #restrictToAttributeSet(Instances, Collection) for this purpose)
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if filename could not be created
        Since:
        0.10 2016-04-20

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Trains a Bayesian network (provided in an XML BIF file) using the given data. The data file must be on one of Weka's accepted file formats (ARFF, C4.5, CSV, JSON, LibSVM, MatLab, DAT, BSI, or XRFF, as of Weka version 3.7.12). The program might fail if the Bayesian network is not in Weka format (use BifUpdate for this purpose). A filtering criterion can be specified, against which only the elements of the first attribute which are equal to it will be selected.

        The method discretizes each attribute to match the number of possible values in its corresponding node (see discretizeToBayes(Instances, BayesNet, boolean)) unless the attribute is already discrete.

        If the file is CSV file, the data is assumed to have originated from the World Bank, and the missing value placeholder is set to "..", but this may change in a future version.

        Parameters:
        args - An array containing, at args[0], the pat of the data file to train the Bayesian network with; at args[1] the path of the file containing the Bayesian network to train; at at args[2] the path of the output file in which to store the trained network; and optionally, at args[3] a filtering criterion and, at args[4], "true" if frequency discrtization is desired.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any of the files could not be read
        Since:
        0.01 2016-04-02
